website_summaries.verdict: An adaptable wall-mounted WiFi extender sporting a bonus power outlet.
pros: Covers 10,000 square feet and utilizes beamforming technology, cross-band technology, simultaneous dual band, and WiFi audio for a stronger WiFi connection
cons: Only features a single Ethernet port

customer_reviews.title: Instructions were easy to follow
customer_reviews.text: I am not a tech person and I had this operational in under 10 minutes. Instructions were easy to follow. My signal strength issue has been resolved. The only downside is that it has its own name & password... so you have to link all your devices to it and connect to it/ select the wifi network as needed. I did not take a star away for this bc I am not sure if this is typical of these extenders or not.
customer_reviews.author: Lilee

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it didn't anymore
customer_reviews.text: After about 8 months of solid performance this thing started acting erratic. Not sure if there was a firmware upgrade or something but for the last few days the extender has been randomly disconnecting. After resetting and reconfiguring multiple times with no change I'll be back in the market for a product that can last a bit longer. Before these issues started I'd have given this 4-5 stars. I get between 250-300 mbps down off of my AC access point and this extender would usually test around 70mbps on the other side of the house. I had the range pretty maxed as far as placement goes so I'm sure that caused the latency.
customer_reviews.author: Keith OConnor

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: This setup initially quite well. Lasted three weeks. Went over resetting with Linksys Help. Could not get it to work again. It is deceptive because it will go through most of the setup screens and then fail, thus consuming a good deal of your time. I've set up several of these (different models) and I'm pretty sure, after spending hours, that the unit became defective for some reason. Due to the frustration, down time, and wasted time, I would classify this extender as junk. I see that it has been marked down but it is still way too much for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Good for 3 Months - Then Not
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in May 2019. Connected easily and worked great. In August, it began to cycle, alternately dropping and finding the wireless signal. Tried to reinstall. After multiple tries, finally got it to reset. Next I tried to set-up again. I tried two different computers and while they found the signal neither could lock on or maintain the Linksys Extender Setup signal to complete the setup program. After several attempts over several days, I give up. UPDATE: After over an hour with Linksys Support, they finally became convinced it wasn't working. Transferred to Customer Service, and after another 20 minutes, they agreed to issue a replacement unit under the warranty - once they get some in stock.
customer_reviews.author: Barry H

customer_reviews.title: Strong and clean signal--excellent device!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those "I should have done this years ago" additions to my woodworking shop. The router is about 100 feet away from my desk in the shop, and the signal must traverse walls, wires, trees, and other signal-strength-reducing items. Until now, I've had to hold my tablet up to the window closest to my house to get even a half bar. Typing in that position has a negative impact on typing speed and comfort in general. Now I have 4 full bars in the shop, and working at my desk is again a pleasure instead of a contortion. Thank you, Linksys!
customer_reviews.author: BillBaileyImages

customer_reviews.title: Works great for a short time.
customer_reviews.text: I installed this unit per the instructions. Though i had to repeat a few times to get it all working, it setup relatively painlessly. It worked great for a day or two but i noticed a few devices were starting to have issues where they had full signal but no internet. I found that i needed to reboot the LinkSys extender to resolve the issue (no big deal). After that devices couldn't stay connected for more than a few hours before i had to once again reboot the device. I reset and reconfigured it multiple times but still ran into the same issue. Finally i decided it was best to return the it while i still could. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: JesseB

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Works Well!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this extender for only about 3 days, but so so far it is working flawlessly. I have a WiFi dead spot in my bedroom where I would only get 1 bar of reception on my cell phone/laptop. Before installing this, I would only get about 10 Mbps download speeds (out of 100 Mbps advertised by my isp). Now I get around 85-90 Mbps.
customer_reviews.author: Josh L

customer_reviews.title: Now I like it !
customer_reviews.text: I was ready to return this item as it would not link up with my Linksys wireless router. I bought a Motorola modem/router combination device and this range extender linked up with it easily. So much for having to stay with the same manufacturer of devices. The range extender is working well ~ providing a strong signal to the opposite end of the house. I would have given this range extender 5 stars had it been able to link up with my inexpensive Linksys wireless router which I had to replace. This extender works well for my application now that I have a modem/router that's compatible.
customer_reviews.author: Kim L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my Linksys in April 2016 and it stopped working 2weeks ago. So it only worked for 6months. At first it was awesome and set up was relatively easy. We were pleasantly surprised at how far our wifi extended to. Great product up until 2weeks ago when it stopped working. Prior to that we did start noticing a few problems probably for about a week before. We noticed the signal would go in & out... We tried the reset button, we also tried unplugging it for a few hours and no luck. Didn't expect it's shelf life to be so short. I also didn't expect to pay about $100.00 for it to only work for 6months.
customer_reviews.author: L. Cardenas

customer_reviews.title: It shouldn't be so difficult.
customer_reviews.text: The instructions should be much simpler, and the telephone support people better listeners. If configuring the device manually, it can only be done with a smart phone - that's not in the instructions, but the support people will tell you this. The instructions are not accurate. Don't be surprised if a configuration page disappears when you make a change, then you start over again. I returned my unit.
customer_reviews.author: Dude

customer_reviews.title: really bad
customer_reviews.text: Shockingly poor wifi signal. I set this up manually since WPS setup would not work. Then it said it was in the best spot. Then I go testing. Not good. I could stand 15ft from this extender (farther from the router) and get a better signal from the router being extended. Huh?!
customer_reviews.author: Luke N. Zankich

customer_reviews.title: Fairly good product
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use this in my house to expand the WiFi signal, however it didn’t work as well as I would have hoped. It was fairly easy to set up and use though which was nice. There is a way to set it up with a separate WiFi connection or all one connection and neither seemed to work as well as I would of hoped, however it did extend my WiFi range somewhat. Overall not a bad product but I wouldn’t recommend it for people who need a large WiFi range extension.
customer_reviews.author: April13

customer_reviews.title: Works but should have more install procedures in advertising
customer_reviews.text: This was the first range extender I ordered and used. I didn't realize until after setting it up that in order to achieve good throughput, I needed to actually physically connect input via ethernet then the wifi strength would be as advertised. Well, I didn't want to purchase a 100 meter cat6 ethernet cable and run it around the walls to the range extender. So, I contacted manufacturer and received full RMA with no restock or shipping fee(s). Otherwise, the range extender did actually work but not as I anticipated.
customer_reviews.author: Maudiib

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but it does drop wifi connection occasionally
customer_reviews.text: Using this product with a Linksys base. It definitely works well to extend the range of my home wifi! My wifi base is in a 1st floor office and this product easily extends the wifi coverage upstairs, down a long hallway, and through multiple walls. Despite being great at extending coverage, the unit does seem to drop wifi occasionally for some unknown reason. 1-2 times per week I'll unplug it from the wall and then plug it back in to reset it. Overall I'm satisfied with the unit!
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Supporting WiFi Extender
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and very good WiFi signal extended throughout our home. Love the built in plug feature. Many do not have this and lots take up so much space that you lose an outlet for other things that require to be plugged in. So far so good and it has been reliable. It is cheaper here than on the manufacturer’s website. In addition, the price was not so exorbitant. It served my purpose without having to go over the top.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Not for power users
customer_reviews.text: Limited use device, geared to internet surfers and low bandwidth demands. Peak speed is ok, but average speed drops to nearly half bandwidth regularly. Barely penetrates through ceiling between first and second floor in brand new house. Throughput is inadequate for streaming large video files (20+GB) over wifi, video freezes and audio glitches every few seconds. My older Netgear WN2500RP using N600 outperforms this alledged AC1200 device consistently and is available for half the price.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, excellent range extension
customer_reviews.text: This is excellent for those in need of extending WiFi range throughout the apartment/house. Whether you have your router on one end of your residence or even upstairs/downstairs, this range extender will even tell you if it's too far or too near your router. Installation is simple, connect to the access point and then connect to your WiFi connection. If your router has two bands (2.4GHz and 5GHz), this will identify and connect to both. From there, you set up this range extender's SSID and security key and voila. Your connection has been extended and you'll even retain your network speeds.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Does not work consistently.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this product does not work very well for me. Setup was a breeze, but it just doesn't work some times, despite not having any error messages. The setup app shows that it's plenty close to my router, but the signal passed through can be very spotty despite a strong signal. I tried setting it up as a separate network (different SSID) to see if that would work for products that are left in this area of the house, but no luck. I would return it but i'm past the return date.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the extra money
customer_reviews.text: The cheaper Linksys RE6300 is far better than the Linksys RE6700. I was hoping the opposite because I liked the fact that I wouldn't lose an outlet. The WiFi is horrible compared to the RE6300. I had to move the RE6700 closer to my router than the RE6300 and it's basically become useless. The RE6300 installed in less than 5 minutes and the RE6700 took nearly an hour to finally communicate with the same router. I wish I would have kept all the packaging so I could return this extender.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, excellent signal
customer_reviews.text: I had a Netgear AC750 for several years that suddenly died. In a panic a went to a local Best Buy and purchased another one. I spent at least 15 hours trying to install the new one, with no luck! In desperation, I said to heck with it and did what I should have done initially and purchased a different brand on Amazon. I purchased a Linksys AC1200. an literally had it up and running in less than an hour. I get a strong signal all over the house. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Diamond M

customer_reviews.title: Quality comes in a brand name.
customer_reviews.text: I was tempted and tried “an extender” recommended by PC Magazine, they don’t always know what they are talking about. Instructions poor, support unintelligible and never worked. Linksys was immediately seen by my colmputer, installed flawlessly and I was done in 20 minutes. Great price and dependable item!
customer_reviews.author: C. Alley

customer_reviews.title: So easy to install, even for me
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Linksys before I bought this one and had to return it since it was suppose to be no box but not used, Well it was used and the instructions were old and could not set up so I returned it This one is brand new and it took me only about 5 min to set it up...perfect, everything went well If you are having problems installing like i did with the first one there is a very helpful you tube setup video
customer_reviews.author: spiritangel

customer_reviews.title: Immediately tripled my throughput upstairs
customer_reviews.text: We recently moved to a larger home, 4 bed 2,600 sq/ft. I work from home upstairs and the stand-alone wifi router downstairs wasn't cutting it. I was getting between 10-15 mb/s out of my 100mb/s xfinity internet. I purchased this little guy yesterday. I was able to get it configured easily in 5-minutes using the web-based setup. Now I get 45 mb/s in my upstairs office. Totally worth the money. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Treadwell

customer_reviews.title: Made the signal worse - among other defects
customer_reviews.text: First, it took way too many attempts before the thing "caught" the router's WPS, or whatever, for initial setup. Second, the difference between the amber (poor signal) and green (good signal) lights is so slight I honestly could not tell them apart. Third, it would not take the new names I kept assigning to the various networks. Last - but not least - the signal is so bad it cuts in and out constantly and is therefore completely unreliable. FEH!
customer_reviews.author: SciCurious

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT WORKS PERFECTLY
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! I'm using it with an old Linksys WRT54GL Router, Set up was manual for me as my router does not support WPS. But it only took 1/2 an hour to do. I went from 1 bar to 4 bars a 100 ft. and 3 walls away from my router. I am now streaming Netflix with no problems, and this is why I bought this unit in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: ok for it's class of product
customer_reviews.text: This is an ok range extender relative to competitors. However, as with all range extenders, it partitions bandwidth and does not leave much downstream. The replacement router from my provider extended range significantly from old version, so no longer need it. But if you do need range extender, this is best in breed.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. Designed to annoy.
customer_reviews.text: Total garbage. Literally every time I wonder why my internet isn’t working on my phone, it’s because it’s connected to this pile of poo instead of my router. Literally works just well enough to be an even bigger pain - if it just didn’t work I’d have removed it months ago. Instead, it works juuust enough to trick you into thinking it works, then just blocks the internet whilst broadcasting a wifi signal strong enough to prioritize itself on any smart device, thereby choking your internet off at the source. Just terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin H.

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: This was super easy for me to setup. NOTE: Print the page at end of setup, this includes your new IP address for the extender. I didn't print and wound up resetting to factory default so I could setup and print that page. Resetting was easy too. This has improved my WiFi signal in my house. I realize that everyone has different setups and configurations of your house make a difference. For me, a low-level tech knowledge this worked great. Whenever I setup new computers or devises, I take a deep breath and prepare for a day of frustration. I was very pleased when this took less than 5 minutes and did all of the setup with simple directions.
customer_reviews.author: seattlegirl

customer_reviews.title: Works well and extends signal to other parts of my large home
customer_reviews.text: Works well and extends signal to other parts of my large home. I researched a lot and consulted with technical staff at Grande Communications who recommended this unit. After two months of constant use I only had to reset it once and relocate it to a better place to pick up the source signal more effectively. Working great.
customer_reviews.author: Thule1

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it. Mine stopped working in less than 2 months
customer_reviews.text: The product is fine at first. Not hard to install. The connection speed is not that fast but is tolerable. After using for less than 2 months, it suddenly disappears from wifi list and can't get back online. And since it already passed 30 day return period provided by Amazon, I can't return it to Amazon. The only choice is to contact the manufacture to honor warrant. But that just doesn't deserve the time and shipping cost. So, don't buy it, and don't fall for Amazon's Choice. Amazon's Choice is becoming Amazon's Bad Choice. I've had a relatively high return rate for products labeled as Amazon's Choice.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Helped increase speed
customer_reviews.text: I recently received this as a free sample. I did before and after tests with my PS4 which seemed to suffer from my slowest connection. This helped more than double my download speeds. I like the fact you don't waste a socket and you get the option to plug in a network cable for the more consistent performance. Only downside is the device is a bit thick, so if you have this behind furniture, it can be hard to plug into the socket. This is a nice solution for those with spotty home wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Razzouk

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother - go Google Mesh
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this and finally get signal all through my house. And yet...constantly lost signal, went offline, was unfindable by my browser. I came on tonight to return it and found I had missed it by ONE day - and now I'm stuck with it. I bought Google Mesh and have screaming speeds in my entire house, which I should have done in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: K. P. Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for--only better
customer_reviews.text: This extender did exactly what I wanted it to. My router is upstairs at one corner of the house, and I found that the signal didn't reach the living room, which is downstairs at the opposite end of the house. With an easy, smooth 5-minute installation process, I was able to plug this device into a downstairs outlet, and I now have good Wi-Fi coverage all over the house--and even outside in my patio. I like that it has a light to let you know it's on, and that it also offers an outlet, so that you don't lose the use of the outlet it's plugged into.
customer_reviews.author: Kreditor

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these. First one was dead in arrival. May have been a used item. Bought a second one. Worked for a couple of weeks. After the first week I lost one of the bands. Second week could not even get back in setup after resetting to factory settings plugged in directly to the router. I tried it unplugged from the router too. Nothing. Buy at your own risk.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Layeski

customer_reviews.title: Good signal boost - half the speed (as expected)
customer_reviews.text: I've tried plenty of solutions for boosting signals, and this is probably the best that I've had. Setup is easy, but as others have mentioned, expect to halve your speed. You'll have a great signal strength, but you won't have the same speed as with your router. No problem me as my main reason for purchasing is the ethernet port that I use to wirelessly hook up my VoIP phone (Ooma). I've tried powerline solutions (pushing internet through your electric wiring) to achieve this before, and the speeds were MUCH slower. This is about the best solution you could hope for. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget LoverTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Completely unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Completely unreliable and will not extend my wifi anymore than the wireless router provided by AT&T U-verse, which is waaaay more reliable. Just completely frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Huff

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in September and now it does not work. Just out of the blue I came home to find it blinking green then amber. Tried resetting it and now it just started blinking amber and will not reset, run setup or restore to factory defaults. I cannot connect via hard connection to my computer either so I can run setup that way.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Hurst

customer_reviews.title: Linksys AC1200 Wi-Fi Extender
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to extend my home wireless signal out to my camper, so the grandkids could stream Netflix out there while they're visiting. I placed the extender 30' from my router, which is a Linksys EA6400, close to the outside wall, in the direction of the camper. The camper is 145' from the house and my Fire TV box picked up the signal. We're able to stream Amazon Prime movies and Netflix just fine. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: McintireP

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant surprise
customer_reviews.text: It extends the signal to places in the house that the wi-fi didn't reach before so it's doing it's job. It came with clear instructions and was easy to set up. The whole set-up took about 5 minutes and it was ready to go. Plugged it in and it's been working well for a couple months now. Even let's my daughter stream Netflix on the Roku at the other end of the house. Definitely a good buy!
customer_reviews.author: PhillyHillbilly

customer_reviews.title: easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up with the router I have: I plugged in the range extender, waited a minute, pressed a button on the router, pressed a button on the extender, waited 30 seconds and it was done. I had half of a bar signal in the master bedroom, now boosted to 3 bars. Couldn't be easier.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen McHenry

customer_reviews.title: Good for a FEW months
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about 3 months, then had to move it closer to the modem to keep connection and now another 3 months and it’s losing connection again. Next move will be to put it in the same room!! Nothing in the house has changed. Modem is working fine. Not even going to bother with support! Guess I’ll try a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: SJS

customer_reviews.title: Out of warranty
customer_reviews.text: I contacted Linksys tech support to assist with installation and they told me this product (Serial Number) warranty expired 4 years ago! The representative was kind enough to extend my warranty for a one year period because I told her I just purchased it from Amazon, and she said it had been sitting on someone's warehouse shelf since 2016. There was no indication from Amazon or from the seller that this was an older product with an expired warranty.
customer_reviews.author: 72 SJ-455

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded our expectations. Works great with CONCRETE WALLS AND FLOORS.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good one!!
customer_reviews.text: This was an easy set up and works well extending our Wi-Fi range. Both kids are able to utilize our Wi-Fi into their upstairs bedrooms, now with the modem being downstairs.
customer_reviews.author: Lorry

customer_reviews.title: No help what so ever
customer_reviews.text: Did not improve the signal. Tried it in multiple areas all showed strong location but the wifi was no better than before and kept dropping from the extender. I can't recommend this at all.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy again I called support to help with setup and they only tried to sell me things I did not need I did not get help with setup
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: super entender
customer_reviews.text: I was sbout to send it back because the Quick start in the box did not cover the setup real good I look for setup on the internet and found several good setup videos on yahoo. I had it setup and connected in less than 5 minutes set the quick instructions aside and look for the setup on yahoo.
customer_reviews.author: George H Dehn

customer_reviews.title: Quit Working
customer_reviews.text: I cannot recommend this extender because mine quit working in four months. Set up was pretty easy and all was well, but now no signal. Not worth being on hold and the aggravation of trying to get customer service. It should just work!
customer_reviews.author: SWB

customer_reviews.title: Slows down & takes over our network
customer_reviews.text: I have tried on 3 different occasions to get this extender to work properly, all to no avail. It has slowed our network down, and often times, randomly attempts a takeover of the gateway IP. Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Annette DiMaggio

customer_reviews.title: great coverage
customer_reviews.text: We needed a new range extender when we installed an outside weather station that connects wirelessly on the oposite side of the house from the cable router. This gives us full bars and high speed thru the entire house, yard and greenhouse. Very easy to install, just make sure the placement is within solid range of the cable router so you have solid signal to extend.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: works great in our basement
customer_reviews.text: Was a little hard to get working correctly because it kept kicking one of our computers off wifi, but thanks to all of those giving advice in the reviews section, we were able to figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: meyouother

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad, but not as Good as I thought it ...
customer_reviews.text: Not Bad, but not as Good as I thought it would be. I had to connect it just about 10 ft away from my router on the second floor. I thought I would be able to connect it in the first floor and expand my signal all thoughout my first floor. The signal is a bit stronger, but I have blackout periods that last from a few seconds to a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Lara

customer_reviews.title: Problem with my router made for difficult extender install
customer_reviews.text: I was on phone for over 3 hours with tech support from linksys who finally had to fix my linksys router in order to work with my linksys extender. Now every thing works great. Great tech support!
customer_reviews.author: ChuckR

customer_reviews.title: Repeatedly disconnects from home router
customer_reviews.text: The device repeated disconnects from my home router causing my laptop to drop off of my home network even though it is well within signal range.
customer_reviews.author: R. J. Galgiani

customer_reviews.title: Works great once I figured out how to install it.
customer_reviews.text: Installation instructions not very clear. But was able to get strong Wifi signal over 300 ft away from my house once it was up and working. Linksys name on a Belkin product.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Sills

customer_reviews.title: Failed after three months
customer_reviews.text: The unit failed after 3 months.The unit worked fine for three months then suddenly failed to connect. I spent an hour online troubleshooting with Linksys support. We reset and reconfigured the unit multiple times. They would not admit that it was a hardware issue. I finally had to give up and toss the unit in the garbage. Update: I was contacted and given an RMA. (I had to pay for shipping and it took 10 days to turn around). The unit is now working as it was before.
customer_reviews.author: E. Christiansen

customer_reviews.title: Works great/Not that easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This extender works exactly how I need it to. The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because the setup process was annoying. I followed the directions too a t and it didn't work. Then all of the sudden out of no where, it just started working.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: just OK.  Not sure I would suggest this as a solution to others.
customer_reviews.text: Works OK. Not seeing that much improvement, but I can't say it does nothing and set up was indeed easy.
customer_reviews.author: Fliptastic

customer_reviews.title: Very good extender, works!
customer_reviews.text: Sets up another network with extension of “_Ext” on the end of your current network. I was doubtful that it would work but in the back of the house where I used to get 2 bars or 1 bar I am full service on the WiFi. Very pleased with this product. Linksys is the name to get, dont mess with the others.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica A

customer_reviews.title: Cant tell if it works
customer_reviews.text: Can't tell if this does anything or not . there seems to be no difference on speed with it or without it . my house is fairly long about 80' and it's put about 30' from the main modem/router . there's definitely no difference in my basement . still get very little speed . I have placed this in several different places with the same results each time .
customer_reviews.author: jamderson

customer_reviews.title: very simple setup
customer_reviews.text: I had no signal for wifi out in the garage. This product was plugged in and it just did the rest. From that point on, I have had strong signal. If my internet goes down, it just reconnects automatically once the internet comes back up.
customer_reviews.author: samintochess

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy if you value money!!
customer_reviews.text: Not the greatest installation instructions and didn’t do much/anything for my signal. Not really sure how but it was even worse sometimes. Seemed to work well at first but within a week was useless. I don’t recommend this item for anyone that values their money. I plan on returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Esposito

customer_reviews.title: Have tried every which way to connect this as directed ...
customer_reviews.text: Have tried every which way to connect this as directed. It DOES NOT WORK. I specifically bought a Linksys product since I already own a Linksys router and thought they would be more compatible. DOES NOT WORK...Will not connect even with the unit only feet from the router...Too late now to return.
customer_reviews.author: Mdewguy

customer_reviews.title: So easy!
customer_reviews.text: After buying two similar Netgear products from Staples (one for twice the price of Amazon) and finding that neither of them worked with our wiring. I turned to Amazon for my old standby, Linksys. (Staples only had Netgear available.) The range extender arrived in two days and within five minutes of opening the box I had internet restored to the far reaches of our house. I literally pushed two buttons and voila! Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be stronger
customer_reviews.text: This needs to be stronger and work in an area farther away from the Wi-Fi. Also, it seems to go out a lot so I have to reset it.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Pidcock

customer_reviews.title: worked fantastic but crapping out now
customer_reviews.text: Got this in Sept.,2017....worked fantastic but crapping out now. I have to keep unplugging it and let it power back. Bought it for my Ring Pro and smartphones. Solved Ring problems. I get excellent 5g speeds equivalent to a hardwired system. 85 up and down!!! So now got to see what I have to go through with Linksys to get it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: BHunted

customer_reviews.title: I have used many other brands of transmitters with poor results but the Linksys AC 1200 was able to ...
customer_reviews.text: I live in an old house and the walls are thick and solid that make impossible to watch internet in the TV in our second floor. I have used many other brands of transmitters with poor results but the Linksys AC 1200 was able to correct the faulty transmission. EXCELLENT PRODUCT!!!!.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos A. Serna

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. This device allows me to have a strong internet connection all over my 1800 square foot house. Had it for one year now without any issues. Do not place it behind anything (tv console, cabinet) or it won’t connect to your router...the light will Flash orange instead of a solid green.
customer_reviews.author: Deon

customer_reviews.title: Not that good
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to not extend and slow the internet down. Even after using the “spot finder” it just didn’t seem to do its job.
customer_reviews.author: fbecker169

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work well through walls
customer_reviews.text: I expected this to perform better through walls. It's hit or miss with a very short distance between plug and doorbell....maybe 4 feet? I do not have concrete walls so I really expected this to do much better than it appears to.
customer_reviews.author: Verified Customer

customer_reviews.title: VERY POOR SIGNAL STRENGTH
customer_reviews.text: I can't get this thing to work 50' from my computer, through 1 wall with a door. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: PJDSR

customer_reviews.title: works better then expected covers large area
customer_reviews.text: works better then expected covers large area, study fast signal mostly using for my IP cam to get study signal sense it placed to far for routers reach, and its not only does the job for cam,but also gives my kid's PS4 hi speed connection...
customer_reviews.author: Rimma

customer_reviews.title: Hardly works at all!
customer_reviews.text: Constantly drops the signal. After resetting, it will work for a few days, then continues dropping signal. I use this to reach a backyard shed not 30 ft from the extender. We have the highest speed internet from our provider, but even when the extender is working, the signal is weak, video is blurry and freezes constantly. This was one of my worst purchases ever.
customer_reviews.author: Francis Maile

customer_reviews.title: This is the second one that I have purchased and the first one worked great for about 9 or 10 months
customer_reviews.text: It did amplify but not much. This is the second one that I have purchased and the first one worked great for about 9 or 10 months. Then it just stopped working and I could never get it to work again even after resetting it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WORKS BUT NOT GOOD LOOKING
customer_reviews.text: Larger and more unwieldy than it appears in the picture but like the other models it is easy to install and works well enough. The Netgear N300 accomplishes the same thing and looks better.
customer_reviews.author: K. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Easy and powerful
customer_reviews.text: This extender has covered the rest of my house with very fast web access. Range is very impressive and setup was very easy. I never got the app they speak of but just using the status light and light color I was able to optimize my network.
customer_reviews.author: jag3man

customer_reviews.title: Plug it in an electrical outlet in the hallway and ...
customer_reviews.text: Plug it in an electrical outlet in the hallway and it will automatically connect to your WiFi router/Access Point. Devices needing WiFi connect to new SSID_Ext, use same password for your wireless router. Boosted my wireless bandwidth 30 fold both download and upload.
customer_reviews.author: Pastor Walt Guimbellot

customer_reviews.title: Not what I hoped for.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, this didn't work as well as I thought. The wifi DID in fact get extended, however the wifi speed was not as promised. It was very slow unfortunately. Mesh networks are the way to go for wifi issues.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT IN MY LARGE HOME
customer_reviews.text: Like many people, I use WiFi all over my home. I needed an extender to make this possible. This Linksys does the job for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Skatvold

customer_reviews.title: Worked for awhile, and then just stopped. Reset ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked for awhile, and then just stopped. Reset & set up again, did the same thing both times. I don't think our new router is the issue, as the phones/tablets can connect to it, but this amplifier just wouldn't stay connected. I only went up one floor, was I too close to the existing router? It didn't say. Just not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony P.

customer_reviews.title: Good Connection, tiny throughput.
customer_reviews.text: Plugged it in about 20 feet away from my router. Gave me a much better signal in my living room, but was only getting 30MBPS. I expected a better throughput since it has so many antennas and I have a gigabit connection.
customer_reviews.author: Dissectional

customer_reviews.title: Work further, do more, faster.
customer_reviews.text: This bridge works amazing. Just setup close to router then move in between you and the router. It boosts signal to bridge the gap.
customer_reviews.author: Check this out

customer_reviews.title: Strong WiFi signal
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it’s supposed to do. I have 4 of these in my house. Easy to set up. Have had some for years & recently bought one for the basement. WiFi signal is now strong.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Works as promised
customer_reviews.text: I use this to give my smart TV a better connection. Works just like I needed it to. Helped improve the bandwidth drastically.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Connectivity reliability
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for a few weeks but then lost connectivity. Was sent a new unit which worked for only a week. Called tech help and they directed me to my internet provider. After upgrading my wireless router, was able to connect but, about two weeks later, started having problems again. Would not recommend if you are a Spectrum customer.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Nash

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and works great.....
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and works great... But I think they could probably have made this even more affordable... Just too pricy a little bit and has very limited features.. 4 stars for that
customer_reviews.author: Aly.

customer_reviews.title: Great repeater
customer_reviews.text: These are made by Cisco. (Linksys) Well made by the premiere IT manufactures. Easy to set up and super quality
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Temple

customer_reviews.title: worked very well for  just 15 months
customer_reviews.text: It worked very well for 15months nonstop 24/7 and then stopped working. All resetting rebooting etc did not bring it to back to life. 15 months is very short for an electronic device today. I expect at least 3-4 years. in the garbage now. shame.
customer_reviews.author: serdar vardar

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up horrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: Horrible service I was trying to get wifi out to a external building like a shed and it wouldn't reach I get WiFi around the outside but not inside and I went to customer service and ask for any suggestions and she said I need a business class device and I should contact the small business class team all for just getting wifi out to a shed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME PRODUCT!!! (at first, then stop working!)
customer_reviews.text: Was Very easy to install and worked right out da box. Worked great for a few Short months, then Completely Stop working. Save ya money and buy something that last. Ya get what ya pay for is True indeed!!!! Junk!
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence J.

customer_reviews.title: Good unit, boosts signal.
customer_reviews.text: I had a bit of trouble on the first setup. Once I figured it out, pretty straight forward. Really does extend the signal.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Record

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This range extender increased the speed of my wireless network from 325Mbps to 867Mbps. It took me a couple times to set it up, but if one follows the instructions it is fairly easy. I now have full signal strength rather than the weak signal that I used to have.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony K. Fields

customer_reviews.title: Might work if you have a weak router. Currently using a Netgear Ac1750 Dual-band
customer_reviews.text: Before swapping out to new router purchased (ac1750 to ac5000), did several speed test. Place farthest area in home. Speed is 14.9/8.09mpbs (5ghz ext) vs. 76.9/24.5 (direct 5ghz connect). Not worth it if you have a decent router. Purchased with hopes it would provided stronger signal towards the front of my home where I have Netgear Arlo. Not only did it not affect favorable speeds, it delivered less than a 3rd of the speed without it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for awhile & it is working great. It was very easy to get working & does a good job at extending our wifi range.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Hanger

customer_reviews.title: Less than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Tried it for about a week and can’t say that I notice any improvement in signal strength or connection.
customer_reviews.author: nckuck

customer_reviews.title: Not a good choice of product
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought two one never did work and the other does not work very well. Could not even return it because when I ordered it did not get delivered before my flight to South America so it took more than six months when I got them and try to use but like I said before one work and the other did not.
customer_reviews.author: Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works phenomenal, save me from having to buy a $350 new router!
customer_reviews.author: JBJ

customer_reviews.title: Bought it used seemed to work but gets hot, ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it used seemed to work but gets hot, get kicked off the 2.4 ghz settings daily and router has a stronger signal I tested both.. I will try another and see if it works..
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Extended our service to the other end of our house.
customer_reviews.text: We had only spotty signalat one end of our house this extender works beautifully!
customer_reviews.author: ap

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and great speeds
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this device to get hard wired network to my desk across the house without running a cable bc the spot is temporary. It has been working very well. Really simple to setup also.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Ward

product_meta.title: Linksys RE6700 AC1200 Amplify Dual Band High-Power Wi-Fi Gigabit Range Extender / Repeater with Intelligent Spot Finder Technology and AC Pass Thru,White
product_meta.description: With the AC1200 MAX Wi Fi Range Extender (RE6700), you can easily expand the range of your existing wireless router. Simply plug the device into a standard wall outlet where you need stronger Internet connectivity say, an upstairs bedroom or office or another remote area of your home. The RE6700 repeats the signal from the router and redistributes it to reduce wireless dead spots.
feature_bullets: Spot Finder Technology to show where to place the range extender using a mobile device for optimum performance and a quick, easy setup
Expands wireless coverage area upto 10,000 square feet; Operating Humidity: 10 to 80 percent non condensing

Speed of up to N300 + AC867 Mbps. The AC1200 amplify is compatible with virtually any Wi Fi router or gateway, including hardware from Internet service providers, and there's no need to adjust your router's settings when installing the extender
Cross band technology maximizes simultaneous use of both bands
Beam forming focuses and strengthens the Wi Fi signal
Wirelessly stream music anywhere in your home using a smart device with the Wi Fi audio feature
Pass through functionality allows you to maintain use of the wall outlet
Ports: Power, Internet, Ethernet (1 4), USB 3.0, USB 2.0 / eSATA combo

specifications.Series: AC1200 Amplify Dual-Band WiFi Range Extndr
specifications.Operating System: Windows, Mac OS, Mac, PC, Windows
